comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Fabulous photo of early Circular Quay! I don't mean to be picky but the Man o;War Steps were/are behind the photographer, the other side of Fort Macquarie. See this 1867 interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm2685-sd&rgn=...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Wow thanks beachcomber :) The landscape looks so different now, it is great to have some buildings / sites identified so that you can feel oriented looking at this pic. Its a fabulous shot!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 15088225@N07
comment._content: Agree with ANMM, it really helps understand the photo having the buildings/sites identified.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Re Miles Buildings (see note at right). John Degotardi (Senior) published a panorama taken from this building in c.1865-68, ie at a similar time. Interesting to see the reverse view - click through to the large size - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=440028#

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for the link beachcomber, so rare that you have these clear examples taken around the same time. They are wonderful photographs!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
